figure.note: Pen and ink drawing: view of Cádiz
figure.label: PORT
LIGHTHOUSE

div.ab: Cadiz said to contain 60 000 inhabitants The houses are high, & well built, but are disfigured by grates of iron at every window. Solano’s house not yet repaired Jany 23d 1809. The whole story of his Treachery said to be fabulous at Cadiz. The streets very narrow but almost all in right lines & generally at right angles to each other. The Theatre fine but being too deep [drawing: plan of theatre] very bad for hearing. The best places seem to be almost all taken by the year, so that a stranger is ill accomodated sic. Saw an excellently acted comedy there El Si de las Niñas The Maidens' Consent, by Leandro Fernández de Moratín (1801; first performed 1806). – The house full every night a thing very rare in Spain. The cathedral a fine building unfinished like all the great buildings of Spain, of white marble heavily ornamented in bad taste corinthian pillars in groupes of 10 &c &c..

ab.note:
الحمد لله على نعمه Laus Deo pro ipsius beneficiis Alhamed lellè halà Nahemhi Praise God for his blessings
Bless God for what exists on capitals احمد الله على نعمه [Arabic – kufic, pen over pencil] I praise God for his blessings
Alhamdu – nahma Alhamdu – of Mecca المكي Of Makkah of Egypt المصريof Egypt/the Egyptian
